intro: Hemizonia lobbii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Hemizonia lobbii is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it adds ornamental value to the landscape. Its unique floral structure and adaptability make it a notable species in botanical studies.
